senses.de: To cause someone to remember something
senses.ex: Let me remind you that the deadline is soon.

Tips.title: Time-sensitive Reminder
Tips.description: Use 'remind' to alert someone about approaching events or deadlines.
Tips.example: The alarm will remind you of your appointment.

Tips.title: Action Prompt
Tips.description: 'Remind' can prompt someone to take action they might forget.
Tips.example: I'll remind Beth to send the email.

Tips.title: Subtle Nudge
Tips.description: 'Remind' is often used to give a gentle nudge about something previously mentioned.
Tips.example: Just to remind you, the meeting was moved to 3 PM.

senses.de: To suggest or bring to mind something from the past
senses.ex: This place reminds me of my childhood.

Tips.title: Nostalgic Connection
Tips.description: 'Remind' can link present experiences to pleasant memories.
Tips.example: The scent of the ocean reminds me of summer vacations.

Tips.title: Emotional Trigger
Tips.description: Can invoke a strong emotional response by referencing the past.
Tips.example: That song always reminds me of home.

senses.de: To cause a feeling or memory to appear in someone
senses.ex: Her stories reminds us of the power of hope.

Tips.title: Shared Experiences
Tips.description: 'Remind' invokes common memories or feelings among a group.
Tips.example: This victory reminds us all of past triumphs.

Tips.title: Inspiration Spark
Tips.description: Brings a sense of inspiration by connecting present to memories.
Tips.example: Her speech reminded us of our shared goals.

Alert.wordDefinition:
Alert means to get someone's attention or warn them about something important or dangerous.

For example, if your friend is about to cross a busy road without looking, you would alert them to be careful. Whereas, if you ask your friend to remind you to bring a textbook to school tomorrow, it means you want them to help you remember something you might forget.

In conclusion, alert is used for immediate warning and attention, while remind is used for recalling an already known or planned event.

Cue.wordDefinition:
Cue means to give a signal or prompt to indicate that a particular action or event should happen, such as a director giving an actor a cue to enter the stage.

Cue is often used in situations where a specific action is required, while remind is used to jog someone's memory or help them complete a task.

Jog.wordDefinition:
Jog means to shake or prod someone's memory so that they remember something.

It is used when someone needs to remember something but has forgotten it temporarily. Example: "Can you jog my memory and remind me of the name of that restaurant we went to last week?".

Jog is used to refresh someone's memory of something they've forgotten, while remind is used to help someone remember something they knew but had forgotten.

Notify.wordDefinition:
Notify means to inform someone about something important, like an event or a change in plans. For example, your school might notify you about a change in the schedule or your friend might notify you about a party.

So, while both words involve communication, notify is used to give new information, while remind is used to refresh someone's memory.

Nudge.wordDefinition:
Nudge means to give a small and gentle push to someone in order to get their attention or to encourage them to take action.

For example, if your friend is sitting around and not doing their homework, you could nudge them to start.

Nudge is used when you want to encourage someone to do something, while remind is used when you want to help someone recall important information.

Prod.wordDefinition:
Prod means to encourage or motivate someone to do something.

For example, if a student is procrastinating on their homework, their teacher might prod them to start working on it by reminding them of the deadline.

Prod is used to encourage action, while remind is used to jog someone's memory.

Prompt.wordDefinition:
Prompt means to give someone a gentle nudge or reminder to take action or do something.

It is typically used when someone needs a bit of encouragement or direction to start or complete a task. For example, a teacher might prompt a student to turn in their homework on time or a family member might prompt another family member to wake up on time for an important event.

To summarize, both prompt and remind involve helping someone take action or remember something, but prompt is used more for encouraging action while remind is used more for recalling information.

Recapitulate.wordDefinition:
Recapitulate means to summarize or give a brief overview of the main parts or points of a larger topic or discussion.

For example, if you were giving a presentation on a topic, you might recapitulate the main points of the presentation at the end to summarize what you've said.

quotes.Text: I think if you're a good person and you show that you learned from all the mistakes that you made you move on with your life. Everybody will accept that. Only an idiot will not accept that or keep reminding you of it and keep pointing that finger.
quotes.Title: Italian Chef
quotes.Name: Gino D'Acampo

quotes.Text: So there's no such thing as one too many this, one too many that. I remember, you're reminding me of early in my career, somebody said to me: why are you taking so many roles as a policeman.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Harvey Keitel

quotes.Text: We are reminded how short life really is, and how we are just passing through. So, all the people you haven't told you love lately, tell them, and live your days like you mean it.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Hal Sutton

quotes.Text: My family got all over me because they said Bush is only for the rich people. Then I reminded them, 'Hey, I'm rich'.
quotes.Title: American Baseball Player
quotes.Name: Charles Barkley

quotes.Text: I think it's good that we're sometimes reminded of important events in history.
quotes.Title: Swedish Actor
quotes.Name: Max von Sydow

quotes.Text: You have to remind people of their own struggles. It's a responsibility.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Elia Kazan

quotes.Text: I want to remind people with dogs that they are your responsibility.
quotes.Title: Japanese Baseball Player
quotes.Name: Yu Darvish

quotes.Text: There's a pleasure in being reminded of the value of ordinary life.
quotes.Title: Author
quotes.Name: Karen Thompson Walker

quotes.Text: I like characters who remind me of someone I know.
quotes.Title: Australian Actress
quotes.Name: Mia Wasikowska

quotes.Text: I like to be reminded that life is going on.
quotes.Name: Miquita Oliver
